prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Billups. Ledger, 1774-1838. Accession 20998, Business records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Lent for copying by W.M. Billups, 1936 April 11.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: John Billups collected the parish levy for Kingston Parish, Gloucester, Virginia. His son, John R. Billups (b. 1803), operated a school in Mathews County, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Ledger records collection of the parish levy for Kingston Parish, Gloucester County, Virginia, by John Billups, with entries for 333 individuals (1774-1775), accounts for various purchases, as well as entries relating to John R. Billups' (son of John Billups) activity as a teacher of Mathews County, Virginia (1827-1831). Also included are Billups family vital statistics, and records of birth, death, and sale of slaves (1803-1838).
